verses.kjv: Then said the high priest, Are these things so?
verses.web: The high priest said, “Are these things so?”
verses.ct: The high priest asked Stephen, "Are these accusations true?"

verses.kjv: And he said, Men, brethren, and fathers, hearken; The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Charran,
verses.web: He said, “Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,
verses.ct: Stephen replied, "Brothers and fathers, listen to me. The God of glory appeared to our ancestor Abraham while he was still living in Mesopotamia, before he moved to Haran.

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.
verses.web: and said to him, ‘Get out of your land and away from your relatives, and come into a land which I will show you.’
verses.ct: God told him, 'Leave your country and your relatives, and go to the land I will show you.'

verses.kjv: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and dwelt in Charran: and from thence, when his father was dead, he removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell.
verses.web: Then he came out of the land of the Chaldaeans and lived in Haran. From there, when his father was dead, God moved him into this land, where you are now living.
verses.ct: So Abraham left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Haran. After his father died, God moved him to this land where you're living now.

verses.kjv: And he gave him none inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on: yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when as yet he had no child.
verses.web: He gave him no inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on. He promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his offspring after him, when he still had no child.
verses.ct: God didn't give him any property here — not even a single foot of ground. But he promised to give the whole land to Abraham and his descendants after him, even though Abraham had no children at the time.

verses.kjv: And God spake on this wise, That his seed should sojourn in a strange land; and that they should bring them into bondage, and entreat them evil four hundred years.
verses.web: God spoke in this way: that his offspring would live as aliens in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.
verses.ct: God told him that his descendants would live as foreigners in a land that wasn't theirs, where they'd be enslaved and mistreated for 400 years.

verses.kjv: And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge, said God: and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.
verses.web: ‘I will judge the nation to which they will be in bondage,’ said God, ‘and after that they will come out, and serve me in this place.’
verses.ct: 'But I will judge the nation that enslaves them,' God said, 'and afterward they will come out and worship me in this place.'

verses.kjv: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: and so Abraham begat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat the twelve patriarchs.
verses.web: He gave him the covenant of circumcision. So Abraham became the father of Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.
verses.ct: Then God gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision. So Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him on the 8th day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the 12 patriarchs.

verses.kjv: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with him,
verses.web: “The patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. God was with him,
verses.ct: The patriarchs were jealous of Joseph, so they sold him into slavery in Egypt. But God was with him.

verses.kjv: And delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
verses.web: and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt. He made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
verses.ct: God rescued him from all his troubles and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. Pharaoh appointed him governor over all of Egypt and his entire royal household.

verses.kjv: Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan, and great affliction: and our fathers found no sustenance.
verses.web: Now a famine came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction. Our fathers found no food.
verses.ct: Then a famine struck all of Egypt and Canaan, bringing terrible suffering. Our ancestors couldn't find any food.

verses.kjv: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.
verses.web: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers the first time.
verses.ct: When Jacob heard there was grain in Egypt, he sent our ancestors there on their first trip.

verses.kjv: And at the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph’s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh.
verses.web: On the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph’s race was revealed to Pharaoh.
verses.ct: On their second visit, Joseph revealed his identity to his brothers, and Pharaoh learned about Joseph's family.

verses.kjv: Then sent Joseph, and called his father Jacob to him, and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.
verses.web: Joseph sent and summoned Jacob, his father, and all his relatives, seventy-five souls.
verses.ct: Joseph then sent for his father Jacob and his entire family — 75 people in all.

verses.kjv: So Jacob went down into Egypt, and died, he, and our fathers,
verses.web: Jacob went down into Egypt and he died, himself and our fathers,
verses.ct: So Jacob went down to Egypt, where he eventually died, along with our ancestors.

verses.kjv: And were carried over into Sychem, and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor the father of Sychem.
verses.web: and they were brought back to Shechem, and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver from the children of Hamor of Shechem.
verses.ct: Their bodies were brought back to Shechem and placed in the tomb that Abraham had purchased with silver from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.

verses.kjv: But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,
verses.web: “But as the time of the promise came close which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,
verses.ct: As the time drew near for God to fulfill the promise he had made to Abraham, our people in Egypt grew and multiplied greatly.

verses.kjv: Till another king arose, which knew not Joseph.
verses.web: until there arose a different king, who didn’t know Joseph.
verses.ct: Eventually a new king came to power in Egypt who knew nothing about Joseph.

verses.kjv: The same dealt subtilly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they might not live.
verses.web: The same took advantage of our race, and mistreated our fathers, and forced them to throw out their babies, so that they wouldn’t stay alive.
verses.ct: This king dealt treacherously with our people and oppressed our ancestors, forcing them to abandon their newborn babies so they would die.

verses.kjv: In which time Moses was born, and was exceeding fair, and nourished up in his father’s house three months:
verses.web: At that time Moses was born, and was exceedingly handsome. He was nourished three months in his father’s house.
verses.ct: It was during this time that Moses was born — an exceptionally beautiful child. His parents raised him in their home for 3 months.

verses.kjv: And when he was cast out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.
verses.web: When he was thrown out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up and reared him as her own son.
verses.ct: When he was finally abandoned, Pharaoh's daughter found him and raised him as her own son.

verses.kjv: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.
verses.web: Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians. He was mighty in his words and works.
verses.ct: Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and became powerful in both his words and his actions.

verses.kjv: And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.
verses.web: But when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers, the children of Israel.
verses.ct: When Moses was 40 years old, he felt compelled to visit his own people, the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him that was oppressed, and smote the Egyptian:
verses.web: Seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him who was oppressed, striking the Egyptian.
verses.ct: He saw one of them being mistreated, so he stepped in to defend him. He struck the Egyptian and killed him to avenge the man who was being oppressed.

verses.kjv: For he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God by his hand would deliver them: but they understood not.
verses.web: He supposed that his brothers understood that God, by his hand, was giving them deliverance; but they didn’t understand.
verses.ct: Moses assumed his fellow Israelites would realize that God was using him to rescue them, but they didn't understand.

verses.kjv: And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?
verses.web: “The day following, he appeared to them as they fought, and urged them to be at peace again, saying, ‘Sirs, you are brothers. Why do you wrong one another?’
verses.ct: The next day, he came across two Israelites fighting and tried to make peace between them. 'Men, you're brothers!' he said. 'Why are you hurting each other?'

verses.kjv: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?
verses.web: But he who did his neighbor wrong pushed him away, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?
verses.ct: But the one who was in the wrong shoved Moses away and said, 'Who appointed you as our ruler and judge?

verses.kjv: Wilt thou kill me, as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday?
verses.web: Do you want to kill me, as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’
verses.ct: Are you going to kill me the way you killed that Egyptian yesterday?'

verses.kjv: Then fled Moses at this saying, and was a stranger in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.
verses.web: Moses fled at this saying, and became a stranger in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.
verses.ct: When Moses heard this, he fled the country and lived as a foreigner in the land of Midian, where he had 2 sons.

verses.kjv: And when forty years were expired, there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush.
verses.web: “When forty years were fulfilled, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.
verses.ct: 40 years later, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness near Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire burning inside a bush.

verses.kjv: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to behold it, the voice of the LORD came unto him,
verses.web: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight. As he came close to see, a voice of the Lord came to him,
verses.ct: Moses was amazed at what he saw. As he moved closer to get a better look, the voice of the LORD spoke to him:

verses.kjv: Saying, I am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. Then Moses trembled, and durst not behold.
verses.web: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’ Moses trembled, and dared not look.
verses.ct: 'I am the God of your ancestors — the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.' Moses was shaking with fear and didn't dare to look.

verses.kjv: Then said the Lord to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet: for the place where thou standest is holy ground.
verses.web: The Lord said to him, ‘Take off your sandals, for the place where you stand is holy ground.
verses.ct: The Lord told him, 'Take off your sandals, because the place where you're standing is holy ground.

verses.kjv: I have seen, I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and am come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send thee into Egypt.
verses.web: I have surely seen the affliction of my people that is in Egypt, and have heard their groaning. I have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you into Egypt.’
verses.ct: I have clearly seen how my people are suffering in Egypt. I've heard their groaning, and I've come down to set them free. Now go — I'm sending you to Egypt.'

verses.kjv: This Moses whom they refused, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge? the same did God send to be a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush.
verses.web: “This Moses, whom they refused, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’—God has sent him as both a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
verses.ct: This is the same Moses they had rejected, saying, 'Who made you a ruler and judge?' Yet God sent him as both a ruler and a deliverer, through the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

verses.kjv: He brought them out, after that he had shewed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red sea, and in the wilderness forty years.
verses.web: This man led them out, having worked wonders and signs in Egypt, in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.
verses.ct: Moses led them out of Egypt after performing wonders and signs there, at the Red Sea, and in the wilderness over the course of 40 years.

verses.kjv: This is that Moses, which said unto the children of Israel, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear.
verses.web: This is that Moses, who said to the children of Israel, ‘The Lord our God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me.’
verses.ct: This is the same Moses who told the Israelites, 'The Lord your God will raise up a prophet for you from among your own people, one like me.'

verses.kjv: This is he, that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sina, and with our fathers: who received the lively oracles to give unto us:
verses.web: This is he who was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel that spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received living revelations to give to us,
verses.ct: This is the man who stood in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai and with our ancestors. He received living words from God to pass on to us.

verses.kjv: To whom our fathers would not obey, but thrust him from them, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,
verses.web: to whom our fathers wouldn’t be obedient, but rejected him, and turned back in their hearts to Egypt,
verses.ct: But our ancestors refused to obey him. They rejected him and in their hearts turned back to Egypt,

verses.kjv: Saying unto Aaron, Make us gods to go before us: for as for this Moses, which brought us out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.
verses.web: saying to Aaron, ‘Make us gods that will go before us, for as for this Moses, who led us out of the land of Egypt, we don’t know what has become of him.’
verses.ct: telling Aaron, 'Make us gods who will lead us, because this Moses who brought us out of Egypt — we don't know what's happened to him.'

verses.kjv: And they made a calf in those days, and offered sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.
verses.web: They made a calf in those days, and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands.
verses.ct: So they made an idol shaped like a calf, offered sacrifices to it, and celebrated what they had made with their own hands.

verses.kjv: Then God turned, and gave them up to worship the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, O ye house of Israel, have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices by the space of forty years in the wilderness?
verses.web: But God turned, and gave them up to serve the army of the sky, as it is written in the book of the prophets, ‘Did you offer to me slain animals and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
verses.ct: So God turned away from them and handed them over to worship the stars in the sky. As it's written in the book of the prophets: 'House of Israel, did you bring me sacrifices and offerings during those 40 years in the wilderness?

verses.kjv: Yea, ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch, and the star of your god Remphan, figures which ye made to worship them: and I will carry you away beyond Babylon.
verses.web: You took up the tabernacle of Moloch, the star of your god Rephan, the figures which you made to worship. I will carry you away beyond Babylon.’
verses.ct: No — you carried along the shrine of Moloch and the star of your god Rephan, idols you made to worship. So I will send you into exile beyond Babylon.'

verses.kjv: Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as he had appointed, speaking unto Moses, that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen.
verses.web: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of the testimony in the wilderness, even as he who spoke to Moses commanded him to make it according to the pattern that he had seen;
verses.ct: Our ancestors had the tabernacle of the testimony with them in the wilderness. God had instructed Moses to build it exactly according to the pattern he had been shown.

verses.kjv: Which also our fathers that came after brought in with Jesus into the possession of the Gentiles, whom God drave out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of David;
verses.web: which also our fathers, in their turn, brought in with Joshua when they entered into the possession of the nations, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers, to the days of David,
verses.ct: The next generation of our ancestors brought that tabernacle with them when they entered the land under Joshua's leadership. God drove out the nations before them, and the tabernacle remained until the time of David.

verses.kjv: Who found favour before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
verses.web: who found favor in the sight of God, and asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob.
verses.ct: David found favor with God and asked for the privilege of building a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.

verses.kjv: But Solomon built him an house.
verses.web: But Solomon built him a house.
verses.ct: But it was Solomon who actually built the house for God.

verses.kjv: Howbeit the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands; as saith the prophet,
verses.web: However, the Most High doesn’t dwell in temples made with hands, as the prophet says,
verses.ct: However, the Most High doesn't live in buildings made by human hands. As the prophet says:

verses.kjv: Heaven is my throne, and earth is my footstool: what house will ye build me? saith the Lord: or what is the place of my rest?
verses.web: ‘heaven is my throne, and the earth a footstool for my feet. What kind of house will you build me?’ says the Lord. ‘Or what is the place of my rest?
verses.ct: 'Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house could you build for me?' says the Lord. 'Where would my resting place be?

verses.kjv: Hath not my hand made all these things?
verses.web: Didn’t my hand make all these things?’
verses.ct: Didn't my hand make all these things?'

verses.kjv: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathers did, so do ye.
verses.web: “You stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Spirit! As your fathers did, so you do.
verses.ct: You stubborn people! Your hearts and ears are closed to God! You always resist the Holy Spirit — just like your ancestors did before you.

verses.kjv: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted? and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers:
verses.web: Which of the prophets didn’t your fathers persecute? They killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One, of whom you have now become betrayers and murderers.
verses.ct: Name one prophet your ancestors didn't persecute! They killed the ones who predicted the coming of the Righteous One. And now you have betrayed and murdered him yourselves —

verses.kjv: Who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not kept it.
verses.web: You received the law as it was ordained by angels, and didn’t keep it!”
verses.ct: you who received the law that was given through angels, yet never obeyed it!"

verses.kjv: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with their teeth.
verses.web: Now when they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed at him with their teeth.
verses.ct: When they heard this, they were furious — grinding their teeth at him in rage.

verses.kjv: But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looked up stedfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,
verses.web: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked up steadfastly into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,
verses.ct: But Stephen, full of the Holy Spirit, looked up into heaven and saw the glory of God, with Jesus standing at God's right hand.

verses.kjv: And said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.
verses.web: and said, “Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”
verses.ct: "Look!" he said. "I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!"

verses.kjv: Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him with one accord,
verses.web: But they cried out with a loud voice and stopped their ears, then rushed at him with one accord.
verses.ct: At that, they screamed at the top of their lungs, covered their ears, and rushed at him all together.

verses.kjv: And cast him out of the city, and stoned him: and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man’s feet, whose name was Saul.
verses.web: They threw him out of the city and stoned him. The witnesses placed their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.
verses.ct: They dragged him out of the city and began stoning him. The witnesses piled their coats at the feet of a young man named Saul.

verses.kjv: And they stoned Stephen, calling upon God, and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.
verses.web: They stoned Stephen as he called out, saying, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”
verses.ct: As the stones rained down, Stephen cried out, "Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!"

verses.kjv: And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had said this, he fell asleep.
verses.web: He kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, “Lord, don’t hold this sin against them!” When he had said this, he fell asleep.
verses.ct: Then he dropped to his knees and shouted, "Lord, don't hold this sin against them!" After saying this, he breathed his last.
